His dream is to see his family’s lifestyle improve. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To puchase a bale of bedcovers and four bales of bedsheets.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo  es un hombre que tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, además  cuenta con 01 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Lorenzo vive en casa propia en el caserío Bodegones del distrito de San José  del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 150 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Lorenzo  es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado porcinos, caprinos, ovinos y cuyes, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Lorenzo cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Su  cónyuge lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Lorenzo se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 3500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de una vaca lechera, ya que cuenta con sembrìo de pasto  y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
38-year-old Lorenzo lives with his partner and their young son in their own home. He tells us that life in his community is based on subsistence. Most residents are self-employed, engaging in trade and small animal husbandry. Some are also involved in agriculture. 

Lorenzo lives in his own house in the village of Bodegones, San Jose, in the administrative division of Lambayeque. He has basic electricity services and receives consumable water via an artesian well. In this village, approximately 150 families live in these conditions.

Lorenzo is a trader. He breeds, fattens and sells small animals such as poultry, cattle, pigs, goats, sheep and guinea pigs. He raises the animals in pens outside his home, and markets them either in the local market and / or at animal wholesalers. Lorenzo has 8 years of experience in his business, which has helped him keep his established clientele. His partner supports him a lot in his activities, and they have a good family relationship.

Lorenzo is now seeking to increase his inventory with regard to marketing, fattening and selling small animals. This is a very profitable activity in his area, and therefore he is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3,500 soles. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, sow the pasture and improve the breeding pens for his animals. In time, this will help him to continue to improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, and improve the breeding pens for his animals.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Pedro, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja de lavado y planchado, para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos todos estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Pedro desde hace varios años tiene su pequeño negocio dentro de un colegio vendiendo todo tipo de golosinas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder contar con el suficiente capital para poder invertir y obtener mejores ganancias . El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de golosinas .
texts.en:
Pedro lives in Ticuantepe with his wife, who works as a laundress to help with their household costs. They have three children in elementary school. Their plan for their family is to improve their living conditions. 

Pedro has had his small business for some years. He works at a school selling all types of snacks. The biggest difficulty is that he doesn't have enough capital to be able to invest and make more profits. He wants the loan to buy snack food.

loans.use: to buy snack foods and sodas.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en: Salina is a 45-year-old single mother of four children aged 20, 12, 7, and 5, respectively. She sells cereals, a business she started 12 years ago. She earns a monthly income of 65,000 KES. She has requested a loan worth 30,000 KES to purchase 10 bags of maize. The anticipated profit will help her to educate her children. She hopes to live a comfortable life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of maize.

loans.name: Jameelah

texts.en:
Jameelah is 43 years old and married. She is a mother of five children and she lives in Baqa'a, Jordan.

Jameelah is looking to have a loan of 500 JD so she can expand her project in blanket sales.

loans.use: to purchase more blankets to sell

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en:
Ekhlas is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Ekhlas is 41 years old and married with four children. She lives in Al Karak, Jordan.

Ekhlas is looking to have a loan of 500 JD so she can improve her house living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her house living conditions

loans.name: Maria Shirley

texts.es:
María es una mujer que tiene  34  años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 01 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que la calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María  vive en casa propia en el caserío CP-2 Cólera del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 150 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  María es la  crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado  porcinos; la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida. Su  cónyuge se dedica  a  la agricultura  en la cual tiene 0.5 ha de limón instalado en fase de producción la que cosecha semanalmente y también  le apoya en estas actividades.
Actualmente  María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a la crianza, engorde y venta de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1,000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados, vitaminas, vacunas y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 34-year-old woman who is in a common-law relationship and has a young child under her care. She lives with her husband and child in her own home. It should be mentioned that the quality of life in her community is subsistent. Most of the residents are independent workers who engage in trade and the breeding of small animals. Some of them are also farmers. María lives in her own home in the village of CP-2 Cólera, which is in the District of Tambogrande in the Department of Piura. The only basic service she receives is electricity. In this village, there are approximately 150 families who live under these conditions.

María raises, fattens, and sells small animals, such as chickens and pigs. The animals are kept in pens outside of her home. Her sales are made at the local market and to wholesale livestock traders. María has six years of experience, which has enabled her to maintain an established clientele. Her husband is a farmer who has a half hectare of lemons that is in production. He harvests each week, so María also helps him with his activities.

María currently plans to expand her inventory for raising, fattening, and selling small animals. This business is one of the most profitable in the area. Because of these circumstances, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN and will invest it in the purchase of balanced feed, vitamins, vaccines, and improvements to the animal pens. Over time, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed, vitamins, vaccines, and to pay for improvements to her animal pens.

loans.name: Las Morenas Group

texts.es:
LAS MORENAS ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO FORMADO POR 6 INTEGRANTES QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN SU TERCER CICLO ,EL GRUPO LLEVA ESE NOMBRE PORQUE LA PESONA QUE ORGANIZO EL GRUPO LE DICEN DE CARIÑO LA MORENITA .

HILDA ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, TIENE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA CON 2 HIJOS. DUARNTE EL DIA, LA SRA HILDA TRABAJA EN SU NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES DESDE HACE 6 MESES ESTO LO HACE PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS Y DARLE UNA MEJOR EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS. ADEMAS, ELLA TAMBIEN TRABAJA LOS FINES DE SEMANA VENDIENDO COMIDAS EN SU DOMICILIO.

HILDA QUIERE SU PRESTAMO PARA AÑADIR UN NUEVO RAMO A SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES QUE ES LA VENTA DE PAPELERIA Y ARTICULOS ESCOLARES YA QUE SU NEGOCIO SE ENCUENTRA AL LADO DE UNA ESCUELA. 

A LARGO PLAZO, HILDA QUIERE QUE SU NEGOCIO CREZCA Y TENER UN LOCAL MAS GRANDE PARA ATRAER MAS CLIENTES.
texts.en:
Las Morenas is a supportive loan group formed by six members that is in its third cycle. The group is called such because the person who organized it is affectionately called "La Morenita" ("brunette").

Hilda is one of the members of the group. She is 35 years old and married with two children. During the day she works at her grocery store. For six months now she has done this to help her husband with expenses and provide a better education for her children. Moreover, she also works on weekends selling food in her home.

Hilda would like a loan in order to add a new branch to her grocery store- selling stationary and school supplies- as her business is located next to a school.

In the long-term, Hilda would like her business to grow and to have bigger premises in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to invest in items to sell stationary.

loans.name: Brunilda Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Brunilda, es una humilde agricultora de la zona de Masaya, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tienen hijos todos independientes, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que toda su vida se han dedicado a los trabajos del campos y todavía no tienen un techo digno , doña Brunilda desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de yuca , la mayor afectación que se le presenta siempre son las plagas que invaden el cultivo . El préstamo lo necesita para sembrar una manzana de yuca. Ya que es el único recursos económico con el que cuentan para poder sobrevivir y llevar el pan de cada día a su familia.
texts.en:
Brunilda is a humble farmer near Masaya. She and her husband, who supports her farm work, have grown children. Their plan for the future is to improve their living conditions, because their whole life has been dedicated to working in the fields and they still don't have a dignified home. 

Brunilda has been growing yucca for some years. The biggest challenge are the pests that invade her crop. She needs the loan to plant a manzana [around 1.7 acres] of yucca. This farm is their only source of income that they have to survive and make their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and inputs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a mother of four. To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes. She has been in the business for 12 years.  She previously sold cereals.  She works hard in her business. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management. This has helped her to invest more in her business. Her desire is to grow her business into a wholesaler in the future. She has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy second-hand clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan, age 33, is an industrious woman who is responsible for five children living together with her in a home located in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to the rice farming business, which provides her family enough for daily sustenance. In addition, she has managed a hog-raising business to earn extra household income. Her husband shares his responsibility to the family by providing transportation services to local people. He owns a horse-pulled trailer for the operation of the business. He just bought his horse but he has not paid the money back successfully. That’s why Chan decided to take out a loan from HKL to pay for horse fees. This will help her husband in his business. In the future, Chan hopes that she will be able to develop her family’s standard of living through her effort and determination.

loans.use: to pay for horse fees.

loans.name: Salinah

texts.en: Salinah is 49 years old, married, and blessed with six children between the ages of 10 and 17 years. She is a dairy farmer, a practice she ventured in to five years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. She has requested a loan of KES 26,000 to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production. The profit she makes will help her pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to be a successful farmer and build rental houses in her plot. This is her fifth loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production.

loans.name: Buthaynah

texts.en:
Buthaynah is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her mother.

Buthaynah is 45 years old, married and a mother of three children. She lives in Irbid, Jordan.

Buthaynah is looking to have a loan of 500 JD so she can paint her home and buy new furniture to improve her house living conditions.

loans.use: to paint her house and buy new furniture

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Faten is 41 years old, married and a mother of four children. She lives in Jabal Al Hussainm, Amman, Jordan.

Faten is looking to have a loan of 600 JD so she can build a roof for her home.

loans.use: to make a roof for her home

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes  (Jipijapa) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes se reúne cada quince días en la comuna Joa del Cantón Jipijapa, esta parte de este cantón se lo conoce por su vasta vegetación y por estar muy cercana a las playas de Puerto Callo.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho en todo este tiempo, ellos llevan 5 ciclos y se sienten muy beneficiados con los créditos recibidos. La mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Quendy, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y de 11 años de edad, ambos  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella con la finalidad de ganar algo extra y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar y la educación de sus hijos, hace tres años en sociedad con su suegro pusieron un negocio de compra y venta de embutidos, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que como su suegro tiene un carro ellos tres veces por semana reciben estos productos que se los envían desde Cuenca y luego  los llevan a entregar a comerciantes minoristas o tiendas de la localidad. Nos cuenta que les va muy bien ya que son los únicos que entregan estos productos por su comuna.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar embutidos para la venta. Lleva 5 ciclos, es la presidenta del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.

Su sueño es tener un carro frigorífico.
texts.en:
The village bank Virgen de Lourdes meets every 15 days in the community Joa del Canton Jipijapa. This part of the canton is known for lush vegetation and for being close to the beaches of Puerto Callo. The majority of the inhabitants are farmers and merchants.

This group decided to come together and form the bank that has been of great help to them in the 5 cycles that they've gone through. They feel like they've benefited a lot from the loans they received. 

Here we meet Quendy, 34, who is married and has two children, ages 14 and 11. The kids are both in school. Her husband is a farmer. 

With the goal of earning some extra money and helping her husband with their household expenses and their children's education, three years ago she and her mother-in-law started a business buying and selling sausages. She says that her mother-in-law has a car and three times a week they get products sent from Cuenca that they then deliver to small merchants or stores in the area. She tells us that it's going well because they are the only ones delivering these products in their community. 

This loan will be used to buy sausages for resale. She's been through 5 cycles and is the president of the village bank. She likes it for the help and benefits that she receives from the bank. Her dream is to have a refrigerated car.

loans.use: to buy sausages.

loans.name: Momonyodema Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Momonyodema” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each woman in order to invest in her respective business. 

Kumba is the leader of this group. Kumba is 30 years old. She is married with four children who are attending primary schools. Kumba sells rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc., and has been doing this business for 12 years now. With the help of this loan, Kumba will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward A. Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged nine and three years, respectively. She runs an M-Pesa shop, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to boost her business by increasing her credit float. Her profit will help her educate her children as well as improve her well-being. She dreams of leading a good life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To boost her M-Pesa business by increasing her credit float.

loans.name: Muriel

texts.es: Muriel con su anterior credikiva compró víveres, ranchos, verduras y frutas con los que incrementó sus ventas, porque consiguió tener un mayor inventario en su haber. Hoy planea recibir un nuevo financiamiento con el que lograr un poco mas de capital de trabajo, para invertir en artículos para el hogar y productos de mayor rotación como frutas y verduras. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los  financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias por su apoyo incondicional que Dios los bendiga por esa buena obra que realizan en nuestro país que tanto lo necesita”
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Muriel bought food products, snacks, vegetables, and fruits to increase her sales. She continued to maintain a large inventory because of the loan.

Today she plans to receive a new loan that will supply her with a little more operating capital. She will invest in household products and items that have high turnover, such as fruits and vegetables. Muriel would like to send the following message to Kiva lenders: "I express my deepest thanks for your unconditional support. May God bless you for the good work that is being done in our country, which is in great need."

loans.use: to purchase household goods and merchandise that has high turnover.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 42-year-old widow with four children aged 22, 20, 19, and 9 years old, respectively. She owns a salon, a business she has been doing for the past six years, and earns a monthly income of KES 22,000. 

She is requesting a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase hair braids, weaves, and hair chemicals, and to renovate her workplace. The anticipated profit will be used to buy more stock for her business. Her dream is to become a great entrepreneur as well as give her children the best education. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase hair braids, weaves, and hair chemicals, and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anielka María

texts.es:
Anielka María es madre soltera la cual lleva la responsabilidad de su hogar de proveer el sustento a sus hijos y darles lo mejor que pueda donde se gana la vida laborando como maestra, salario que le permite cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Es una mujer 
Emprendedora que ha sabido criar sola a sus hijos.
Hoy en la actualidad está solicitando su primer crédito en Ceprodel para comprar zinc 12”, ladrillo, hierro, varilla, cemento, perlines y pago de mano de obra con el fin de terminar de construir una habitación para brindarles más espacio a sus hijos.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para cumplir su objetivo y poco a poco cumplir su sueño de ver su casa realizada ya que con estos créditos es la única manera de realizarlos porque con su pequeño salario no podría llevarse a cabo estos sueños.
texts.en:
Anielka María is a single mother who carries the responsibility of her home and provides sustenance for her children to give them the best she can.  She makes a living working as a teacher, making a salary that allows her to fulfill her obligation.  

She is an enterprising woman that figured out how to raise her children by herself.  Presently she is requesting her first loan from Ceprodel to buy Zinc 12’’, brick, iron, rod, cement, [perlines] and to pay for laborers in order to finish constructing a bedroom that will give her children more space. 
 
She hopes and trusts in God that her request for a loan will be approved so that she can obtain her goal and little by little realize her dream of seeing her house finished.  These loans are the only way that she will be able to realize her dreams because with her small salary she is unable to do so.

loans.use: to buy Zinc 12'', brick, iron, rod, cement, [perlines] and pay for laborer work force.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is a woman with two children between the ages of one and six years, both of whom are enrolled in school. She is married to William, a store keeper. Constance operates a charcoal-selling business and has been in this business for the last year. She sells her charcoal both from home and as retail, mostly to neighbors and passersby. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She aspires to open a shop in the future and states that she will use the loan of 20000 KES to buy sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 53 years old. He lives in Khoni District, West Georgia, with his 27-year-old son. Robert earns a living through his agricultural business. The family has a vineyard with 100 vine trees. Robert produces wine and sells it in the village. They also have 150 nut trees. Nuts are also sold in the village. The total average monthly income for the family is 300 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category.

Robert requested credit for purchasing a mini-bus. With his mini-bus he will transport the passengers between Khoni and a neighboring district.  His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and who are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit he receives, Robert will be able to start a new business providing transportation service to the Khoni District population. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Along with the above-mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus.

loans.name: La Paix 1 Group

texts.en:
Pierre Berno, age 34, is married with a 5-year-old child. He is representing the "La Paix 1" group. He sells used clothes in the local market in Brazzaville. He has had this business for 3 years. He is a very motivated young man. Pierre Berno is also a city bus driver, a position that allows him to make a little extra income. He will buy bales of used clothing with the loan. In Congo used clothing is put into large bales and sold in bulk by suppliers. His business strategy is to welcome each customer and offer good customer service. 
Pierre Berno has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue to expand his business and offer a greater variety of clothing items. He will use some of the profits from his business to put his child in a good school as well as provide for and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to pay for bales of clothes to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 54 years old, married, and has two children. For ten years, she has been running a grocery shop. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to add business stock with her previous loans. She has also bought a solar lamp which she uses to light her business in the evening. Anne hopes to grow her business and open other outlets. She has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy vegetables, onions, and bananas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, onions, and bananas.

loans.name: Osmelia

texts.es: Osmelia con su anterior credikiva compró un freidor, un molino manual y adecuó las conexiones de gas natural. Ella está muy satisfecha porque logró mayor comodidad y efectividad en su producción. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará refrescos por cajas y silletería. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente” “Gracias por el crédito que me hicieron. Me sirvió bastante para el negocio ya que me aumentaron las ventas por la comodidad familiar”.
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Osmelia bought a deep fryer and a manual grinder. She also had a natural gas connection installed. Osmelia is very satisfied because she is comfortable and effective in her production.

She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan so that she can buy soft drinks by the case and seating. Her message to the Kiva lenders is as follows: "Thank you for the loan you have made to me. It has served me well because the sales in my business have increased, allowing my family to live comfortably."

loans.use: to buy soft drinks by the case and seating.

loans.name: Yelva Aracely

texts.es:
Doña Yelva Aracely, desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar para ayudarle a su mamá y hoy que tiene su hogar lucha diariamente por ayudarle a su esposo a llevar el sustento a su hogar y aportar un granito de arena para construir con todas las condiciones su vivienda.
Se desempeña como profesora  en un colegio
 dónde pone todo su empeño por enseñar a leer y escribir a los niños los cuales son el futuro de Nicaragua donde tiene gran experiencia en este ramo por tener muchos años de dedicarse a esta profesión.
Con la esperanza de cumplir su sueño de ver su casa realizada se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel con el fin de que le otorgaran un crédito para la compra de cemento, perlines, arena y pago de mano de obra para llevar a cabo la obra de construir una habitación
texts.en:
Since Yelva Aracely was a young girl she has been working to help her mother, and now she has her own home. She struggles daily to help her husband to bring money home and buy sand to construct their house. 

Yelva Aracely works as a school teacher and does her best to teach reading and writing to children, who are the future of Nicaragua. She has a lot of experience and has worked in this profession for many years. 

Yelva Aracely hopes to fulfill her dream of finishing her house. She approached Ceprodel for the first time to request a loan to purchase cement, beams, sand and payment of labor for constructing a room.

loans.use: to purchase cement, beams, sand and payment of labor for constructing a room.

loans.name: Basawadima Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Basawadima” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each member in order to invest in her respective business. 

Josephine is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and married with five children – one in primary school, three in secondary school, and one in college. Josephine sells cooking oil, rice, drinks, mints, etc. With the help of this loan, Josephine will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward A. Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc., at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 52 years old. He lives in the small village of Tskaltubo District with his 15-year-old son, Irakli. Irakli goes to school. Zurab’s wife lives out of the country. Zurab earns a living through agricultural business. He has 2 milk cows. Zurab produces cheese. Also he grows greens on a family-owned plot of land. Zurab sells greens and cheese on Kutaisi open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 150 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category.

Zurab requested credit for purchasing materials for greenhouse construction. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and who are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Zurab will purchase wooden materials and a polyethylene cover. He will construct the greenhouse on a family-owned plot of the land and grow vegetables and greens there during whole year. Zurab will sell harvested products on Kutaisi market. This will significantly increase the income of the family. Zurab will be able to create better living conditions for his son and himself. Along with the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en: Munhbayar is a 19-year-old man who lives with his wife and a daughter in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. He married his wife one year ago. Even though they are young and new to business, they started an activity. He has been running a garment retail business since 2011. Now he is planning to increase the types of products because his business has already been appreciated by the customers. Munhbayar is an active young man who is full of new ideas and says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the supplies in large quantities in different styles". The total amount he is requesting is 3,900,000 MNT to buy garments.

loans.use: To buy garments.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She sells household goods such as shoes, toys, and bedding, and has been in the business for ten years now. She gets a monthly income of 50,000 KES. This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of shoes, toys, and bedding for sale. In the future she wants to invest more in her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, toys, and bedding for sale.

loans.name: Mwasi

texts.en:
Mwasi is 31 years old, married, and has three children. He sells livestock to earn a living. He has employed one person in his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money because he has been trained in business management skills.

Mwasi hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Deuslyne

texts.en: Deuslyne is 31 years old, married to Nicodemus, and blessed with two children, aged 12 and seven years, respectively.  She hawks sodas, a business she has been in for four years, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 15,000 to purchase 15 crates of sodas for sale. The profit she earns would be ploughed back in her business. Her dream is to see herself prosper in this business as well as to educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 15 crates of sodas for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is taking out another loan of 40,000 KES to start a new business operating a vegetable stall. With the loan, she plans to add stock of vegetable and fruits for sale. Since the previous loan, her living standards have greatly improved. Her monthly income has increased and she can now pay school fees for her children without any burden.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetable and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Leh We Help Weself Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Leh We Help Weself” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each lady in order to invest in her business. 

Fanta is the leader of this group. Fanta is 55 years old and married with four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school. Fanta sells shoes and ready-to-wear clothes. With the help of this loan, Fanta will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of shoes and clothes to add to her business.  

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward A, Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes and clothes to add to her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married lady aged 40 years old. She supports six children aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 5, and 3 years old. She rears layers in their farm and has been in operation for a period of three years earning a monthly income of KES 13,000.  


She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and intends to purchase more chicks to rear for sale. 

The earned profits will be used to purchase a dairy cow. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family and expand her poultry farm.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a single lady aged 41 years old who is blessed with two children, aged 17 and 14.  She owns a green grocer store and has been in operation for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,500. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase vegetables and fruits and cater for transport cost.  

The profits earned will be used to educate her school-going children and plough back into business.  Her dream is to become successful in life and in business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Jaqueline María

texts.es:
La joven Jaqueline María, la cual es una joven que desde muy temprano labora para ayudar a su humilde familia con los gastos del hogar y para pagar sus estudios.
Por tal razón se desempeña como profesora de un colegio,  donde se gana la vida dignamente.
En la actualidad está estudiando una carrera universitaria ya que tiene la visión de llegar a ser una excelente profesional y piensa en el futuro de tener su propio hogar y con todas las condiciones que hoy le han faltado por recursos económicos.
Por primera vez está solicitando un crédito para pagar los gastos de la universidad ya que no quiere que esto sea un obstáculo para culminar su carrera y llegar a ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
This is Jaqueline María, a young woman who, from a young age, has worked to help her poor family with household expenses and to pay for school. She currently teaches in a school where she earns a decent living.

Jaqueline María is studying towards a university degree, and her vision is to become an excellent professional. She thinks about having her own home in the future, with all the facilities that she has been missing due to her economic resources.

For the first time, Jaqueline María is requesting a loan which she will use to pay her university expenses as she does not want this to be a barrier to embarking on her career and becoming someone in life.

loans.use: to pay her university expenses

loans.name: Tayorma Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Tayorma group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in order to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each member in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 
Dora is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a farmer and has eight children. Dora has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She produces and sells soaps. With her share of this loan, she will buy caustic soda, palm-oil, and other supplies for the production of a larger quantity of soaps for sale. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward A. Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy caustic soda, palm-oil, and other supplies for the production of a larger quantity of soaps for sale

loans.name: Shiiter

texts.en: Shiiter is a 41-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in the central province of Mongolia. His wife is employed. Two of his children go to secondary schools. He started a freight transportation business in 201. He owns a small truck that he uses to deliver sacks of coal into the city. He has been supporting his family members with the business income. Shiiter is a clever man who says that, "I would like to increase the business activities by repairing my truck. Because it has been broken down, it needs to be repaired in order to stabilize the business. I am planning to develop the business, not stop it." The total amount he is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts for the truck.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the truck

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 30 years old and married. He is a father of three children aged ten, seven and one. He owns a butcher shop, where he sells cow and goat meat, and he has been in the business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.  
He is servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET and intends to purchase a cow and goats for slaughter. The anticipated profits will be put back into the business. He hopes to expand his business to other locations.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and goats for slaughter

loans.name: Quiedondoya Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Njama, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is 35 years old. Kadiatu is married to a businessman and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Kadaitu sells market-food, including palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, salt, rice, etc. 

With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy palm oil, margi, pepper, salt, rice, etc., in larger quantity to add to her current stock.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward A. Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, pepper, salt, rice, etc., in larger quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: God In Blessing Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God in Blessing” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu. Kadiatu is 49; she was born in Koidu city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a pastor and her children are in college. For over a year now, Kadiatu has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), salt, pepper, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc. With this loan, she will buy palm oil, salt, pepper, margi, tomatoes, etc., at wholesale to add to her business.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward A. Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, salt, pepper, margi, tomatoes, etc., at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Nelson Billy

texts.es: El señor Nelson, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tienen dos hijos y necesitan de sus cuidados , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que ellos son muy humilde y su gran sueño es poder construir su casita de bloques , don Nelson desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio de chinelas , sillas de plásticos , ropa ,etc. Pero su ganancias no le ajustan para poder invertir de una sola vez en materiales de construción y poder construir un baño digno ya  que el actual está muy deteriorado, prácticamente esta por caerse. El préstamo lo quiere para construir el baño.
texts.en: Nelson is a resident of the municipality of Ticuantepe. His wife works selling fruit and vegetables to support him with the household expenses as they have two children and must care for them. Their future plans are to improve their living conditions as they are very humble, and their great dream is to be able to construct their home of blocks. For several years now Nelson has been making a living selling flip-flops, plastic chairs, clothing, etc. However, his earnings are not enough to be able to invest in construction materials at a single time and be able to build a decent bathroom since their current one is very run down and practically about to fall over. He would like the loan to build a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sueamaya Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Elizabeth was born in Koidu city 43 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For five years now, Elizabeth has been selling sweets, biscuits, drinks, mints, etc. This is the first loan that Elizabeth and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Elizabeth will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward A. Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy sweets, biscuits, drinks, mints, etc., in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Suyunbubu

texts.ru:
Суюнбубу 55 лет, замужем, воспитала 7 детей. Суюнбубу в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1978 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки коровы. На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Суюнбубу  имеется 1 дойная корова, 5 лошадей и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход с продажи  молочных продуктов составляет 3,500 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суюнбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения продаж молока.  Доходы от кредита Суюнбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Suyunbubu is 55 years old, she is married and has raised seven children. Suyunbubu started her business as a main source of income for her family and since 1978 she has been engaged in animal husbandry which she started with the purchase of a cow. Today Suyunbubu's livestock has one milk cow, five horses and twenty sheep. Her monthly income from the sale of dairy products is 3,500 som (KGS).

With the goal to further grow her business Suyunbubu has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy a milk cow to increase milk sales. Suyunbubu plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anielka Karina

texts.es:
La joven Anielka Karina, como hija responsable y abnegada piensa en el futuro y mejorarle cada día la vivienda a su madre.
Labora como profesora de secundaria desde hace 4 años.
Una de las necesidades que tiene en este momento es mejorar la habitación de la vivienda donde habita por lo que se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel con el objetivo de que le otorgaran un crédito para la compra de cemento, hierro, arena, puerta y pago de mano de obra.
Confía en Dios y pone la esperanza en esta Institución para que le apoye con este sueño de mejorar su vivienda y salir adelante ya que estos créditos son de gran ayuda para los asalariados y personas de bajo recursos.
texts.en:
This young woman, Anielka Karina, is a responsible and devoted daughter who thinks about the future and wants to improve her mothers home. She has been working as a high school teacher for 4 years.

Anielka Karina needs to improve the bedroom of the house where she lives, and so she approached Ceprodel for the first time to request a loan for the purchase of cement, iron, sand, a door and payment of construction labor.

She trusts in God and hopes that the institution will support her in her dream of improving their house and moving forward, because these loans are helpful for salaried workers and low-income people.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand, a door and payment of construction labor.

loans.name: Gissela Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Gissela, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no tiene hijos. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella y su esposo se dedican a la cría de pollos y aves de corral, tienen una granja en la cual por temporadas meten hasta  300 pollos, los mismos que los crían  por espacio de tres meses y que luego los entregan a comerciantes, o los llevan a entregar a tiendas de la localidad, nos cuenta que llevan tres años dedicados a este negocio y les va muy bien, la mejor temporada es la del mes diciembre en estas fechas venden hasta 500 pollos. 

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos construyeron un galpón más grande y pudieron aumentar su producción.
 
Sus sueños son comprar un carro para vender otras ciudades y aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño Jesús" (Divine Christ Child) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

Sra. Gissela lives in this place. She is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has no children. Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband raise chickens and other poultry. They currently have a farm on which they can raise up to 300 chickens at a time. The birds are raised in that space for a period of three months before being sold to merchants or delivered to local stores. Gissela says that she has been in this business for three years and has done very well. Her best season is the month of December when she can sell up to 500 chickens.

This loan will be used to buy chickens, feed, and medicines so that the birds can develop properly. Gissela has been with her Communal Bank for two years and enjoys being a member because the loans helped her to build a large chicken coop so that she could increase her production. Her dreams are to buy a car so that she can sell in other cities and to increase her business even more.

loans.use: to buy chickens, poultry feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Jesucristo

texts.es: Jesucristo de 58 años de edad,  vive con su cónyuge y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 28 y 33 años, en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, un lugar muy cerca al mar, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene una remontadora de calzado de la cual genera ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su hogar. El tiene su pequeño ambulante taller que rueda desde su vivienda hasta la plaza principal del pueblo, donde se ubica y es muy reconocido por todos los pobladores de Puerto Colombia. En su negocio presta el servicio de reparación de toda clase de calzado; él cambia suelas, arregla tacones, hace tinturado a la capellada de los zapatos y también hace costuras de los mismos ocasionalmente. Este oficio lo aprendió desde muy joven con un señor en a plaza de San Nicolás de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Con su trabajo provee lo necesario para vivir dignamente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que comprará materiales e insumos que usa a diario, como suelas, plantillas, caucho y goma al por mayor, para ganar descuentos por la cantidad y tener un stock,  que le permita atender más oportunamente a su clientela. En su buen humor caribeño Jesucristo se considera que con su nombre no tiene tocayo (una palabra usada para referirse una persona respecto de otra que posee el mismo nombre) y dice que entre risas y bromas que le presten con confianza porque “Jesucristo no le queda mal a nadie“. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que le hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque tiene muchos sueños como el de abrir un local publico y organizar mejor su negocio y con su crédito empezará el camino a sus metas, porque como el dice tiene poca formación académica pero está graduado en la universidad de la vida.
texts.en:
58-year-old Jesucristo lives with his wife and two children, aged 28 and 33, in the town of Puerto Colombia. The town is very near the sea, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. There, he has a shoe cobbling business which generates revenue to support his family and household. He has a small travelling workshop that he rolls from his house to the main square where he works, and he is recognized by all the people of Puerto Colombia. 

Jesucristo provides repair services for all kinds of footwear - he changes soles, fixes heels, dyes the uppers of the shoes and occasionally stitches them. He learned this trade at a young age, from a gentleman in St. Nicholas square in Barranquilla. His work provides him with enough income to live in dignity. 

Jesucristo is currently applying for this loan, with which he will purchase materials and supplies for everyday use such as soles, insoles, rubber and shoe uppers. He will purchase wholesale to benefit from bulk discounts and build up a stock, which will allow him to serve his customers in a more timely manner. 

In good humor, Jesucristo considers that with his name, he has no 'Tocayo'  (a word used to refer to another person that has the same name), and between laughter and jokes he says that people lend to him with confidence because "Jesus Christ did not hurt anyone."

This loan is the first loan that he has taken with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, because he has many dreams as opening his own public premises. He wants to improve the organization of his business, and this loan will begin the path to his goals. Jesucristo says that he has little academic training, but he is a graduate of university life.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies for everyday use such as soles, insoles, rubber and shoe uppers in bulk.

loans.name: Mercedes Stella

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Mercedes,  tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos de 20 y 14 años de edad, los mismos que  estudian en universidad y colegio, los cuales representan muchos gastos para nuestra amiga. Lleva 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio y ha podido salir adelante sola con sus hijos.

Ella con la intención de ganarse la vida  y con esto poder salir adelante junto con sus hijos  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, sabanas, toallas, toldos, entre otros productos, nos cuenta que vende lo que sea con tal de ganar algo y que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene dos  vitrinas, sus hijos le ayudan cuando están desocupados. Trabaja todos los días más que todos en las mañanas, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil o a Cuenca cada vez que necesita. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto ha salido adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, sábanas, toldos, zapatos entre otras cosas.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesús (Divine Child Jesus) Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Jipijapa canton, which is known by the name "The Sultana of Coffee" due to its extensive cultivation of a coffee with an incomparable flavor. The canton is also known for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people.

This is where we meet Ms. Mercedes. She is 41 years old and the single mother of two children aged 20 and 14 years old. They are studying in college and high school, respectively, which presents many expenses for our friend. She has been in the Communal Bank for six years and she enjoys it because thanks to the loans, she started her business and has been able to get herself and her children ahead on her own.

She got involved in commerce with the intention of making a living so that she and her children could carry on. She sells all types of clothing, shoes, sheets, towels, and awnings, among other products. She tells us that she sells what she does in order to earn some, and that her children never want for anything. Her manner of sales is door-to-door, although she also sells at her home, where she has two display cases. Her children help her when they are not busy. She works every day, mostly in the mornings. She sells to her customers on credit and bills them every eight days. She goes to buy her merchandise in Guayaquil or Cuenca whenever she needs to. She has been in this business for six years and has gotten ahead thanks to it.

This loan is going to be used to buy more merchandise, such as clothing, sheets, awnings, shoes, and other things.

Her dream is to see to it that her children finish their studies and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sheets, awnings, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Policarpo

texts.es: Policarpo con su anterior  credikiva compró retazos de textiles y elaboró muchos tapetes que vendió y ganó dinero. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir un nuevo credikiva y con él aumentará el volumen de sus compras de textiles porque tiene muchos encargos y necesita mantener materias primas en stock, para enfrentar el periodo de escases que se acerca.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias les doy,  porque he podido trabajar cómodamente y generar empleo a 5 personas, con lo que mejoran sus ingresos”.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Policarpo bought fabric remnants and was able to produce several tablecloths which were sold for money. At the moment, he is preparing to receive a new Kiva loan so that he can increase his volume. He is planning to buy textiles because he has many orders and needs to maintain his stock of materials for when such items are in short supply.

Policarpo sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: "I express many thanks for what you have given me because I can work comfortably. With my improved earnings, I have created jobs for five people."

loans.use: to buy fabric remnants in bulk.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 31-year-old single lady with one child. She has a business which retails cosmetics, mobile phones and provides M-pesa (a mobile phone-based money transfer service). Millicent has been in this business for seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.  

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to increase her M-pesa float. With the profits, she will buy a plot of land. In future, she wants to build her house.

loans.use: to increase her M-pesa float

loans.name: Na God Dae Gee Group

texts.en:
The members of the “Na God Dae Gee” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to each apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Adama, aged 37, is the leader of this group. She is married to a driver and they have three children who attend primary and secondary schools. Adama has been a businesswoman for many years now: she sells market food – rice, fish, pepper, salt, palm oil, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy rice, fish, pepper, salt, palm oil, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her current stock. 

 (Also included in the photo is loan officer, Edward A Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy rice, fish, pepper, salt, palm oil, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Hawa from Waterloo, a neighborhood in Freetown. She is a widow and has three children between the ages of 16 and 30. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2004, Hawa established her general merchandise business. She began her business because she wanted to have a permanent source of income to support her family. She works seven days per week and 10 hours a day and earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. Hawa describes her major problems as inadequate electricity supply and rapid increase in transportation costs.

She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 which she needs so she can buy different kinds of drinks and water packets for her business. Hawa hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit to approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Hawa plans to open her business in other areas within her township. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of drinks and water packets.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan con su anterior  credikiva compró cera y una estampadora, para adecuar una vez más sus panales. Así mismo compró implementos para fabricarlos, envases y etiquetas para comercializar su dulce miel. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que comprará una maquina centrifugadora, y más cera estampada e implementos para nuevos paneles. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecido por el gran apoyo recibido por ustedes y por la oportunidad que me han dado de que mi negocio sea conocido por otros, así mismo por la capacitación y asesoría de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.“
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Juan bought wax and honeycomb foundation so that he could produce more honeycomb panels. He also purchased equipment for processing, packaging, and labeling the sweet honey that he sells. Juan is currently applying for a Kiva loan so that he can buy a centrifugal machine (for extracting honey) and more honeycomb foundation and tools for making new panels.

His message to the Kiva lenders is as follows: "I am extremely grateful for the overwhelming support you have given me. This opportunity has given people the chance to become familiar with my business. I also appreciate the training and advice from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo."

loans.use: to buy a centrifugal machine for extracting honey, honeycomb foundation, and tools for producing more honeycomb panels.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a businessman who runs a spare parts shop.  He has been operating his business in the town centre.  This is a good strategic location  because he gets many customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business. Peter has also been trained in financial management. This has helped him to save his money.

Peter dreams of opening a wholesale business in the future.  He needs a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is a 51-year-old single woman with four children. She operates a grocery store where she sells both vegetables and cereals. Eddah has been in this business for 30 years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more rice. With the profits, she will expand the business. In future, she wants to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to buy more rice

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old, married to Michael, and together they have two school-going children. She rears sheep and later sells them, mostly to other traders in the market as well as to hotels at a profit.

Margaret learnt about KADET during one of their marketing events in the area. This will be her first loan and she plans to use the loan amount of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more sheep to rear and later sell at a profit.

In the future, Margaret hopes to expand her business and to earn more income hence improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Faith Sisters Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Faith Sisters” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariama. Mariama is aged 36; she was born in Kono where she is currently residing with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Mariama has been selling shoes. With this loan, she will buy shoes at wholesale prices to add to her business.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer, Edward A Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale prices to add to her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 40 years old. She is widowed with three children. She sells charcoal and vegetables and has been in the business for the past one year.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of charcoal and vegetables for resale.

She hopes to get a permanent place to do her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. She sells mobile phones/ electronics, has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of 100,000 shillings. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD: she plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock and to open an M-Pesa business (a mobile phone-based money transfer service). With the profits, she will buy a plot of land. She would like to have a good future.

loans.use: to buy more stock and to open an M-Pesa business

loans.name: Luciah

texts.en:
Luciah is 69 years old. She is married to Warige and all their children are adults: none are dependent on them. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 32 years.

This is her first loan after she was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings and to pay laborers to assist her with planting.

She hopes to build and own rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings and to pay laborers to assist with planting

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old and is married with four children. He operates a restaurant and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. He will use the loan amount to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar and drinks for use in the restaurant.

He hopes to open a bigger restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 27 years old, married and blessed with a one-year-old child. She has been operating a tailoring business for five years and employs two people in her business. Through Faulu Kenya, Alice has learnt how to save her money because she has been trained in financial management.

Alice hopes to open a dressmaking college in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 29 years old, married and blessed with a three-year-old child. He sells secondhand clothes so as to earn a living.  He has employed two people to assist him in the business. He also operates a retail shop so as to supplement his income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in financial management. This has helped him to budget well in his business.

Timothy hopes to expand his business and employ more people. He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add to his stock of clothes

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 43 years old and married with three children.  To earn a living, he runs a tailoring business. He has been operating this business for over 10 years.  He has employed two people to assist him in his tasks. Besides tailoring, he does poultry farming to supplement his income.

Paul has experienced upward growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he has been trained in business management.   Paul hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 42 years old. He is married to Mary and together they have four children. He buys and sells wool and has been in this business for the past four years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by staff. Patrick will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of wool for resale in his business.

He hopes to be a renowned wool dealer in his area.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of wool for resale.

loans.name: Neveen

texts.en:
Neveen is 26 years old and a married woman, a mother of three children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Neveen is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can buy and sell clothes so her social and economic status will improve.

Neveen is under 30 years old, so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Miriam Antonia

texts.es:
Miriam, administra una pupuseria, vive con su esposo, la casa es familiar, tienen 4 hijos de 14, 11, 8 y 4 años de edad, desde hace ocho meses ha iniciado con la venta de pupusas, pues inicialmente solo administraba una tienda.
Ella quiere realizar una inversión en el negocio, comprándose maíz, aceite, condimentos, quesillo, y otros materiales que son necesarios para realizar la venta, con este préstamo estarán mejorando su nivel de ventas.
Su objetivo es tener un negocio más grande, con más clientela y que le provea mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Miriam manages a "pupuseria" (a restaurant that serves "pupusas"). She lives in the family home with her husband and four children (ages 14, 11, 8, and 4). Miriam began selling "pupusas" eight months ago. Before that, she managed a store by herself.

Miriam wants to invest in her business, so she will buy corn, oil, condiments, cheese, and other supplies that are necessary for her to make sales. This loan will help to improve her sales levels. Her goals are to have a larger business, obtain more customers, and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, condiments, cheese, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is 28 years old and a married woman. She lives in Al Karak, Jordan.

Rawan is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can pave the floor of her house.

Rawan is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pave the floor of her house

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Alimatu from Waterloo, a neighborhood of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 10 and 21, all of whom currently attend school. In 2008, Alimatu established her food container business: she sells cooking pots, saucepans, rubber buckets and dishes. Alimatu began her business because she needed a permanent source of income to support her family. She works at the business from 7:30 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price fluctuations.
 
Alimatu requires a loan in order to buy more food containers such as cooking pots, saucepans, rubber buckets and dishes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Alimatu plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food containers such as cooking pots, saucepans, rubber buckets and dishes.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia sells curtains in Nakuru town and has been in this business for 11 years. She is 49 years old and a single mother to four children. Teresia plans to use the loan amount to purchase more curtain stock to sell in her business as the demand has increased a lot.

This will enable her to meet her clients' demands. With the anticipated profits, she plans to move to a permanent stall from which to sell the curtains.

In the future, Teresia hopes to expand her business by supplying the curtains at wholesale prices to other traders, thus earning more income and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more curtain stock to sell

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 46 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Darhan-uul province, Mongolia. Her husband is a carpenter and her two kids live independently. She started her garment retailing business in 2001 by renting an outdoor counter. Her garments are high quality and affordable. 

Now that her children live independently, she has time to expand her business. Oyunchimeg is planning to have her own counter. She's requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy summer garments for her business. She is a smart hard-working woman who says, "Now that I finally have time to spare, I want to make the most of it."

loans.use: To buy summer garments

loans.name: Jawhara

texts.en:
Jawhara is 27 years old and married. She is a mother of three children. She lives in Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan.

Jawhara is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can expand her trading in blankets sales. She will buy more blankets in wholesale and sell them in retail.

Jawhara is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy blankets for trading purposes

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 23 years old. She is married to Geoffrey and together they have two children. She sells clothes and has been in this business for the past two years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. Tabitha was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of new clothes to sell in her business.

Tabitha hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and is married with three children. He sells cereals and has been in this business for the past six years.

This is his first loan. Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of maize, beans and green grams (mung beans) to sell.

He hopes to venture into the real estate business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize, beans and green grams (mung beans) to sell.

loans.name: Maisoon

texts.en:
Maisoon is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Maisoon is 25 years old, a mother of 2 children, and she lives in Idon, Irbid, Jordan.

Maisoon is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can expand her store and buy merchandise for it. Maisoon is under 30 years old so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Eman is 29 years old. She is a mother of three children and she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Eman is looking to have a loan of 400 JD to buy new furniture and paint her home to make it more comfortable for her family.

Eman is under 30 years old, so her loan is a youth loan

loans.use: to buy new furniture and paint her home

loans.name: Bassama Organisation Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Bassama Organisation” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each member of the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Sarah, aged 40, is the leader of this group. She is married to a civil servant and they have four children. Sarah has been a businesswoman for many years now: she sells market food – palm oil, margi (which is used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her business. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer, Edward A Ndoinjeh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her business

loans.name: Ne'ameh

texts.en:
Ne'ameh is 40 years old and married. She is a mother of five children. She lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan.
Ne'ameh is looking to have a loan of 600 JD so she can expand her work in clothing sales to increase her income. She will buy more quantities of clothing for trading.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is 21 years old and single. She lives in Al Salt, Jordan.

Fatema is looking to have a loan of 1,000 JD so she can sell various quantities of cosmetics.

Fatema is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Hob Alwtn Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hob Alwtn. It consists of four members: Salma, Shwayh, Amnh and Fatima. They are ladies who are responsible for their families. Their community is a rural area surrounded by fields where they make Yemeni bread. They have many clients, mostly women. 

Salma is 28 years old. She is the coordinator of her group. (She is the second woman from the left side on the photo). She is a divorced woman and has one daughter. In the beginning, she learned how to make bread from her neighbors, then continued her activity. It is the main source of income so that she can help raise her daughter and give her a good education.   

Salma's most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to improve her business structure. She is receiving a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy bread materials like flour, salt, yeast and baking soda for her business.

In the future, she would like to expand her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bread ingredients like flour, salt, yeast and baking soda for her business.

loans.name: Abatarambirwa Group

texts.fr:
Safiya fait partie du groupe Abatarambirwa et  habite à  Ngozi. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Ramazani,  un commerçant des habits. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgé de 6 à 15 ans, tous  étudient à l’école primaire.

Elle est  commerçante d’huile de palme depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de bidons d’huile de palme, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait chercher le raccordement de l’eau et de l’électricité de son domicile et acheter une autre parcelle.
texts.en:
