María Eugenia tiene ingresos adicionales generados por 2 taxis de servicio público y también presta el servicio de peluquería siempre que puede,  a clientes fijos que no cambian su servicio de belleza y confían en sus conocimientos y experiencia, para lograr el mejoramiento de su imagen. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará  mercancía ajustada a la temporada de celebración del día de las madres, la secretaria, época en la cual sus ventas se incrementan y ella ajusta su oferta a las necesidades de su clientela femenina, que compra cosméticos, ropa, calzado, productos para el hogar y papelería. Y esta es justamente la razón del éxito de su inversión producto del credikiva.
texts.en:
María Eugenia, 62, is a widowed woman who has four children and lives in the city of Barranquilla.  There she has a little general store and sells a variety of merchandise retail, such as stationery supplies, articles of silver, clothing, footwear, etc.

Her entrepreneurial experience dates to 25 years ago when she began selling fried pies, fried foods, and fast food in general.  It went very well for her in this and so she planned to travel to a border town where she bought various articles, such as sweaters and bedclothes, at good prices; she sold to customers who had asked her to buy for them.

Some time later she got pregnant and was unable to continue to travel.  She sought the help of a partner but the business did not work out and it brought her losses.  This is why she decided to study cosmetology, and when she finished her studies, she got a job in a beauty salon where she acquired a lot of experience for 13 years.  It went very well for her, but her husband got sick and she had to abandon this work to care for him exclusively.

When he died, she was alone and she decided to generate income by selling merchandise.  She began to travel to the city of Medellín to buy merchandise, and as it went well for her, later she acquired her display cases and she stocked them.

Currently she is very highly regarded in her neighborhood.  Her main customers are neighbors, family members, friends, and referrals, preferably school and university employees, who buy from her to pay in negotiable installments.

In her business she receives her daughter's help taking care of the daily sales in her shop, which require her to be on duty all the time because she does business in cash.  They are very close in her family and her children and grandchildren are part of it.  She shares all the household expenses with them.

María Eugenia has additional income generated from two public-service taxis.  She also does hairdressing when she can for steady customers who do not change their beauty service and who have confidence in her knowledge and experience to improve their image.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy merchandise for the celebration of Mother's Day, a time in which her sales increase and she adapts her offerings to the needs of her women customers, who buy cosmetics, clothing, footwear, home products, and stationery.  And this is precisely the reason for the success of her investment, the product of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, footwear, home products, and stationery.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia is 37 years old and is widowed with six children, five of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Proscovia has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells dried fish. 

Proscovia is requesting a 200,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy fish to sell. Her loan will help her expand her business and generate greater profits. Proscovia will use the profit from her loan to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to be able to continue to expand her business. 

Proscovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Proscovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Polonuevo, donde se dedica a la confección de ropa, experiencia que data desde cuando trabajó en una gran empresa, que se dedicaba a esta actividad. Desde hace 5 años ejerce el arte de la costura, de  manera independiente trabajando con  las técnicas de lencería y elaborando hermosos  ajuares para bebés. Su negocio le ha resultado muy provechoso,  porque ha ganado paulatinamente una clientela fija y a esta misma aprovecha,  para venderle mercancías variadas, negocio que adicionó para generar nuevos ingresos con su gran potencial de compradores, que cada día le refieren a otros  nuevos.    Su meta mas adelante es organizar su taller y tener su propio almacén, pero su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo le resulta insuficiente, para alcanzar sus propósitos. En la actualidad esta aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas, telas e insumos, comprará vitrinas para ordenar su exhibición  y aumentar sus ventas, cumpliendo con pedidos de sus mas apreciados clientes, quienes preparan sus regalos para celebrar el día de las madres y muy seguramente lo hará obsequiando detalles, que Lisbeth ha escogido con la calidad y ternura que la caracterizan con la que tiene a sus clientes estimulados a comprarle
texts.en:
Lisbeth, age 46, lives in the Polonuevo municipality.  She makes clothes, and her experience dates back to when she worked for a large company making clothes.  She has been exercising the art of making clothes for five years.  She works independently using the techniques to make lingerie and making beautiful outfits for babies.

Her business has been very profitable because she has gradually won over a fixed clientele.  She takes advantage of this in order to sell varied merchandise.  She added this business in order to generate new income with her great potential to have buyers.  Each day they refer new buyers to her.  

Her goal for later is to organize her shop and to have her own store.  However, her greatest challenge is that she does not have enough working capital to achieve her objectives.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials, fabric, and supplies.  She will buy showcases to arrange her display and increase her sales.  She will fill the orders of her most  valued customers.  

Her customers are getting gifts ready to celebrate Mother’s Day.  They very surely will do so by giving gifts that Lisbeth has selected.  She does so with the quality and tenderness that she is known for, which motivates her customers to buy from her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, fabric, and supplies.  She will buy showcases to arrange her display and increase her sales

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old. She is single and is raising five children, only two of whom are her biological children. For the past eight years, Grace has been selling eggs. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client and this will be her first loan.

Grace is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of eggs to resell. In the future, she hopes to establish a permanent location where she can raise poultry instead of only purchasing eggs.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en:
Misheck is 36 years old. He is married to Monicah and they have four children. For the past six years, Misheck has been a farmer and he earns a good income. This will be his second loan with KADET LTD. Misheck repaid his previous loan well and on time.

Misheck is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for this planting season. In the future, he hopes to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is married and has four children, two of whom attend school. He has been farming for one year and sells his farm produce to his neighbors. 

Hamisi is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase planting seeds and cultivate his farm.  Hamisi faces a major challenge during dry season. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Hamisi aspires to have more sophisticated farm equipments in the future.

loans.use: to purchase planting seeds and cultivate his farm.

loans.name: Pedrina Iduvina

texts.es: Pedrina Iduvina de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida. Ella posee una panadería donde vende pan en variedad dulce y salado, quesadillas, tortas, pastelitos entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona pues vende el pan más rico y calientito además está elaborado con material de primera calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; Pedrina es una mujer emprendedora, honesta y sobre todo humilde, dispuesta a superarse y lograr un triunfo  a futuro, piensa que la presión y los desafíos son su más grande oportunidad de crecer, es así como se ha decidido solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, dulce, levadura etc. Pedrina tiene la esperanza que dado que su sabroso pan está siendo mas demandado y al incrementar su oferta obtendrá mayores ganancias, así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedrina Iduvina is 57 years old and lives with her life partner.  She has a bakery where she sells sweet and salted bread, quesadillas, pies and cakes, among other things. She is well known in the region since she sells the freshest and mos delicious bread.  Furthermore, it is produced with high quality ingredients and she sells it at really affordable prices. 

Pedrina is an enterprising, honest and above all humble woman, ready to overcome and achieve a triumph in the future.  She thinks that pressure and challenges are her biggest opportunity to grow. So, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy flour, sugar, jam, yeast, etc.  Pedrina has the hope that, given that her delicious bread is more in demand and upon increasing her supply she will obtain higher profits, in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jam and yeast

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has one child.  She is a baker, which she has been doing for 45 years. She bakes bread to sell.  Ama uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home.  

Ama is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil  for her bakery. With the profits, she will buy the morden type of oven to make her baking easier.  Ama is standing in front of the oven she uses to bake.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil  for her bakery.

loans.name: Ishmeal

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Ishmael from Waterloo, a neighborhood in Freetown. He is married with three children between the ages of nine and 15. He also has five relatives who live with him at home. For the past 11 years, Ishmael has been running a container store where he sells a variety of rubber and plastic containers. He works seven days a week from 8:00 am through 7:30 pm. His business is his only income source and his main business challenge is inflation.

Ishmael is requesting a loan to buy a variety of empty containers. He will use the profit from his loan to educate his children and increase his savings. In the future, Ishmael plans build more shops and expand his business. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of empty containers

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is 46 years old and a married woman, a mother of 7 children. She lives in Al Karak, Jordan.

Salwa is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can sell clothes to improve her social and economic level.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Salamatu from Calabatown, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 24 and 27. One of her children attends school. Salamatu has four additional dependents that live with her because they are relatives from her village.

Salamatu runs a cookery where she prepares and sells local food such as fried rice, cassava leaves, soft drinks, and rice. She also runs a store where she sells cement. She has been running these businesses for 18 years and she works 11 hours every day except public holidays. Salamatu’s husband also provides income with his work as a driver. Her business challenges include transportation costs and time, as it takes her two hours to buy ingredients from town and return home. Salamatu starts preparing food at 4:30 am and she will not rest until it is finished.  

Salamatu is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase more cement. The extra income from her loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her cement store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cement

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is twenty-five years old, a married man with one child, and he is a dairy farmer.  He has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of twenty-five  thousand shillings.


This will be his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase animal feeds. In future he wants to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase  animal feeds.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa is a small-scale trader who has been selling saucepans, glass plates, and cups for three years now. Adwowa is a single parent and has three children, and she uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. 

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase saucepans, glass plates, and cups to sell. With the profits from the loan, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household items to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is forty-one years old, a married lady with three children. She is a farmer, has been in the business for twelve years now, and gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 


This will be her third loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs to improve her farming.


With the profits, she will rent another piece of the land. In future she wants to be a successful farmer

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa is a small-scale trader, and she has been selling plastic bowls for three years now. She is a single parent and has four children, and she uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase plastic bowls and baskets to sell. With the profit from the loan, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls and baskets to sell.

loans.name: Nidian

texts.es: Nidian de 53años, vive en Soledad y es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 16, 24 y 30 años respectivamente. Ella tiene una miscelánea donde vende diversas mercancías y también se dedica parte de la mañana a preparar y vender almuerzos. Ambos negocios generan ingresos con los que ha generado cada día un mayor bienestar para sus hogares. Su vida como comerciante inició hace 6 años, vendiendo productos mediante guías especializadas, su negocio paulatinamente ha ido creciendo y por eso ha vinculado a él vitrinas, donde se ven bien exhibidos sus productos. Adicionalmente vende dulces, minutos a celulares, que se constituyen en otros ingresos, aprovechando a su clientela cautiva, que la visita día a día. Realiza las ventas de contado y a crédito, estudiando bien a su clientela. Los productos de dulcería y los insumos para preparar almuerzos, los adquiere en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla de contado, mientras las mercancías que ofrece en sus catálogos las adquiere a crédito. Su meta mas adelante, es hacer un local de mayor tamaño, donde funcione solamente su negocio, pero su gran desafio es lograr tener un fondo de efectivo suficiente para ampliar su negocio, responder a su clientela y tener siempre bien surtida su miscelánea. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financieminto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará productos cosméticos por catalogo, dulcería e insumos en mayor volumen para producir aun mas alimentos. Su éxito en esta inversión radica en su experiencia y que además su compra responde a los pedidos de su clientela y a la rotación actual de sus productos.
texts.en:
Nidian is 53 years old and lives in Soledad.  She is the mother of three children who are 16, 24 and 30 years old.  Nidian has a general store where she sells a variety of merchandise.  She also spends part of her mornings preparing and selling lunches.  These businesses both make her income which has helped her to improve the well-being of her household.

Nidian's life as a saleswoman began six years ago when she started selling products through specialized catalogs.  Her business has slowly grown and she has bought display cabinets where she can display her products nicely.  In addition, she also sells sweet treats and cell phone minutes which makes her additional income.  She makes the most of the fact that she has 'captive' customers who visit her each day.  Nidian makes her sales for cash and on credit, after carefully weighing up her customers.  She acquires her confectionery products and the supplies she needs to prepare her lunches in Barranquilla city center for cash.  She buys the merchandise that she sells through her catalogs on credit.  

Nidian's goal for the future is to have larger premises which are dedicated to her business.  However, her biggest challenge is having enough cash funds to expand her business, respond to her customers and ensure she always has a well-stocked store.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use it to buy catalog cosmetics, confectionery and a larger volume of supplies so that she can produce even more food.  Her success with this investment lies in her experience and the fact that her purchase is responding to orders from her customers and her current product turnover.

loans.use: to buy catalog cosmetics, confectionery and a greater volume of supplies for making food

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 6 Group

texts.en:
Sandra is the coordinator of her group, Ayudanos Señor 6 (Help Us Lord 6). Her group is located in a rural area surrounding La Romana, called Bateyes, amid sugar cane fields. Sandra makes her home in a simple structure where she lives with her long-term partner and their two children. She is a very hardworking woman who is committed to her plans to change her family’s life and provide better living conditions including a better house and a good education for her children.

Sandra is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She runs a general store from her house and she will use her loan to increase her inventory by buying clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories. Sandra sells to her neighbors from home and she also walks into other communities. She plans to re-invest her profits into her business.

Sandra hopes to improve her house and business by saving and trying to have a stable source of income. She is very committed to making her dreams come true and she believes that, with God and this loan, she will have the opportunity to grow. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
For 20 years now, Aba has been producing palm oil for sale at Mpredwow near Cape Coast. She is a single parent with four children, and she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.   

Aba will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and kernels to produce her palm oil for sale. With the profit from the loan, Aba will buy a machine to produce her palm  oil.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her palm oil business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with five children. She has been operating a grocery shop at Batanyaa for 15 years. She sells items like tins of fish and tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. Lydia uses her income to support her husband and to pay their children’s school fees.    

She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profits from the loan, Lydia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 39 years old, married and with two children. She runs a grocery business to earn a living. She has been in the business for 8 years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Hannah hopes to expand her business so as to employ people in her business. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy carrots, peas and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy carrots, peas and potatoes

loans.name: Rosebell

texts.en:
Rosebell is 41 years old and a single mother of two. She has been running a school for 3 years with six employees. She also does poultry farming to supplement her family's income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Rosebell has been able to run her business well. This is because she has been trained in business management skills.

Rosebell hopes to increase the number of pupils in her school. She also dreams of expanding her poultry farm. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is a hairdresser. She owns the beauty salon at Batanya near Cape Coast. Emilia is married with 3 children. Her husband is a welder. Emilia has been a hairdresser for 5 years. She uses her income to support the husband to pay their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to acquire equipment to make work easy.

loans.use: purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 39 years old, married and with three children. To earn a living, she runs a cafeteria. She has been in the business for 3 years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Joyce has improved her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Joyce hopes to grow her business and become more financially stable. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy beverages.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a petty trader. She sells groundnuts which she has done for 6 years now. Ama is single. She lives at Batanya, near Cape Coast. She uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of groundnuts to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of groundnut to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old, married, and has five children.  He runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  He has been operating the business for two years and has employed one person. He has grown his clientele because of his good reputation.  
Charles desires to open a big hotel in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to pay wages to his new workers.

loans.use: To pay wages to his new workers

loans.name: Glenda Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Glenda, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada pero aun no tienen  hijos. Su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días por las mañanas ya que a esta hora es más fresco y se le hace más fácil salir y también vende en su casa a la hora que deseen sus clientes, ella deja a crédito  y cobra cada ocho o  quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 años, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño Jesús" (Divine Christ Child) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Glenda. She is 35 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband owns an auto repair shop.

Glenda intends to earn her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing of all types by going door-to-door, but she also sell from her home since customers come to visit her. Glenda works every day in the mornings since this is the coolest time of the day, thus making it easier for her to travel. She also sells from home whenever her customers feel that it is convenient for them. Glenda extends credit for her products and collects payments every eight or fifteen days. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil as often as needed. She has been in this business for five years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing. Glenda has been with the Communal Bank for six years and serves as president of the group. She enjoys being a member because one of the loans was used to start her business. Her dream is to have a shop in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Semeo

texts.en:
Semeo is 33 years old. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been running the business for 8 years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management skills. This has helped him to improve his business, hence more profits.

Semeo hopes to expand his business premise in the future. He needs a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy cooking fat, soda and sugar.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, soda and sugar

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is 30 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs and needs.

Fatema is requesting a loan for $2,000 from FATEN, which she will use to help her cover the costs of finishing her house, including installing tiles,  windows, and doors. This will improve the house's condition and enable the family to live in it soon. 

Fatema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband AbdulRaheem appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the family's new house.

loans.use: to finish her house.

loans.name: Eudora

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Eudora from Krootown central area in Freetown. She is divorced with 1 child, age 21 years. She has 3 additional dependents that live with her at home. She is also working as a teacher to increase her source of income. 

Eudora runs a provision and variety store within a business market area. She sells biscuits, pads, rubber drink, milk, sugar, energy bulbs and other items. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business 7 days per week. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenges to her business are competition in the market and low capital to operate her business.

Eudora has requested a loan in order to buy more variety of stock such as biscuits, pads, rubber drink, milk, sugar, energy bulbs and other items. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her savings. In the future, she plans to open a bigger shop within the township. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more variety of stock such as biscuits, pads, rubber drink, milk, sugar, energy bulbs and other items

loans.name: Nafetha

texts.en:
Nafetha and her husband are photographed in the picture.

Nafetha is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and a mother with five sons and two daughters. One of her daughters has a beauty salon, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Nafetha is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as living room and bedroom furniture, instead of the very old furniture she has. Taking this loan will offer to Nafetha and her family comfortable home furniture and create to them suitable home conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small business, selling motor spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more items, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and expand his business. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big company. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to stock more items in his shop

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a food vendor. For two years, she has been cooking banku, which she serves with okro and fish stew, for sale. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and three children at Batanya near Cape Coast. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for the preparation of her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mariama from Calabatown, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of two and five. Mariama also has one additional dependent living with her at home. For the past 12 years, she has been running a general store where she sells onions, tomatoes, milk, sugar, and Ovaltine. Mariama started her business to generate more income to send her child to school. She works seven days a week, 10 hours a day. This is her only source of income and her major business challenge is price inflation. 

Mariama is requesting a loan to buy more onions, tomato paste, milk, sugar, and Ovaltine. The extra income from her loan will allow her to pay her monthly installment and educate her children. In the future, Mariama plans to open another branch in town. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomato paste, sugar, and Ovaltine

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  To earn a living, she runs a laundry business.  She has been running the business since 2004 and has employed one person.  She has stabilized her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  This has helped her to educate her children.
Faith hopes to grow her business and open other outlets in the future.  She needs a loan of 20 000 Kenya shillings to buy iron box.

loans.use: To buy an iron box

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 31 years old and married.  She sells potatoes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for over 10 years.  She has employed people to assist her in the business.  She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.
Catherine hopes to buy a hand cart for transporting potatoes to her business premise so as to save on transport costs.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes.

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili is 56 years old, married, and has seven children. She owns and operates a business venture, making elei (Samoan printed cloth), which she has been doing for one year. 

Saili is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy materials and paints. She hopes to use her profits to expand her elei business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to purchase materials and paints to expand her elei business

loans.name: Pepeu

texts.en: Pepeu is 70 years old, married, and has five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling handicrafts in her community. To do this, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy crafts to sell and materials such as timber for carving. In the future, Pepeu hopes to exports some of her handicrafts overseas. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to start a small business selling handcrafts in her community.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher, photographed inside his house, is a 27-year-old young man. He is married and the father of one son and one daughter. He is a taxi driver who earns low income. He also works in the field of electrical connections. This is profitable work but not enough to cover all of his family's needs.

Maher is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of finishing his house, such as painting and installing tiles. This will enable Maher to ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to finish building a new residence.

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en: Tiresa is 42 years old, married, and has one child. She has a plantation where she grows taro, banana, taamu, and ufi that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Tiresa needs a loan to to pay for cement, nails, a hammer, timber, and iron roofing to improve her home. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her home

loans.name: Manu

texts.en: Manu is 36 years old, married, and has six children. She wants to start a small business making and selling German buns  in her community. To do so, she is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, coconuts, and plastic bags. In the future, Manu hopes to build her own food stall. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to start her business such flour, sugar, and coconuts.

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es: Alexandra está satisfecha por el resultado de su anterior credikiva, pues logró comprar en un mayor volumen y reparara algunas herramientas de trabajo con las que a logrado mayor efectividad y tranquilidad. Ahora se prepara para recibir un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos e iniciará un negocio de restaurante mas organizado, asociada con una compañera, el cual ya está funcionando. En su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva, agradece la ayuda y que sigan apoyando a las microempresas. Auguramos éxitos en su inversión.
texts.en:
Alexandra is satisfied with the investment of her previous loan because she was able to buy supplies in large lots and to repair some of her business equipment. This has made her more productive and given her peace of mind.

She is now ready for a new Kiva loan to buy supplies and to start a better equipped restaurant in which she and a friend would be partners. Her message to Kiva lenders is that she is grateful for their support and that they should continue funding micro businesses. She predicts their investment will lead to success.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to equip her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49-year-old Rebecca from Calabatown, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 11 and 32. Two of her children currently attend school and one is in university. For the past 16 years, Rebecca has run a bar and restaurant within a busy market where she sells soft drinks, Star Beer, Heineken, chicken snacks, fried fish, and fried rice. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband to support her family. Rebecca’s other source of income comes from renting out an old house. Her major business challenges are poor electric power supply and transportation costs.

Rebecca is requesting a loan to buy a variety of drinks and a generator. The extra income from her loan will allow her to increase her savings and educate her children. In the future, Rebecca plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks and a generator

loans.name: Tuilagi

texts.en:
Tuilagi is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a general store selling a variety of products in her community, which she has been doing for three years. 

Tuilagi is requesting a loan to expand her store. She plans to use her profits to continue improving the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to build up her inventory

loans.name: Izzeddeen

texts.en:
Izzeddeen is a 28-year-old single young man. He has been driving a taxi for 5 years, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover his needs and costs.

Izzeddeen is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of licensing the taxi and making some necessary improvements to it such as changing the lights, installing new wheels and mirrors. This will increase the taxi efficiency and capacity and make it legal to move from one area to another. This will help to improve Izzeddeen's income positively.

Izzeddeen is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and improving the taxi's condition

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured inside the house.

Dalal is a Palestinian married woman and the mother of three sons and six daughters. Three of her daughters are married, her eldest son is an engineer, and her husband is a worker who earns a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Dalal is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing the necessary construction supplies to finish building her house and improve its condition. This will help Dalal to move the rest of her family into the house sooner and to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to finish building her house.
